dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: TikTok says 'in the process of restoring service' after going dark in US, citing Trump 'clarity'
News Content: TikTok said Sunday afternoon it was in the process of restoring service to its US users after going dark overnight when a new law banning the app took effect at midnight.

In a post on X Sunday afternoon, TikTok said, "In agreement with our service providers, TikTok is in the process of restoring service. We thank President Trump for providing the necessary clarity and assurance to our service providers that they will face no penalties providing TikTok to over 170 million Americans and allowing over 7 million small businesses to thrive."

In a social media post on Sunday, Trump asked tech companies to "not let TikTok stay dark" and reiterated his plan to issue a reprieve once he takes office.

"I will issue an executive order on Monday to extend the period of time before the law’s prohibitions take effect, so that we can make a deal to protect our national security,” Trump posted. “The order will also confirm that there will be no liability for any company that helped keep TikTok from going dark before my order."

TikTok's statement followed roughly two hours later.

Beginning late Saturday, US TikTok users were shown a message saying the app wasn't available, citing the new law.

The alert also mentioned Trump by name saying, "We are fortunate that President Trump has indicated that he will work with us on a solution to reinstate TikTok once he takes office."

On its website, TikTok told users they could still login to download their data. As of Sunday afternoon, that message had been updated to read: "We're working hard to resolve this issue. Thank you for your patience."TikTok went dark Saturday night, just ahead of a ban on Sunday. (Source: Yahoo Finance/Dan Howley)·Howley

Still, many on Capitol Hill — not to mention outside experts — questioned whether Trump will have the authority to make good on these promises.

Some of Trump’s closest political allies are also the most outspoken critics of TikTok, and have so far stood by the law that they passed last April with strong bipartisan margins.

In a statement early Sunday, Republican Sens. Tom Cotton and Pete Ricketts said, "now that the law has taken effect, there’s no legal basis for any kind of 'extension' of its effective date." Cotton added earlier this week on the Senate floor that "there will be no extension, no concession, and no compromises for TikTok."

Story Continues

House Speaker Mike Johnson, another top Trump ally, also raised questions Sunday, telling NBC he wanted to see the current law enforced and that he is "really heartened to see that Google and Apple and Microsoft have taken the steps to comply with the law."

The back-and-forth between Trump, TikTok, and US lawmakers will remain in acute relief on Monday, with TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew expected to be in attendance at inauguration events.

Rolling shutdown

Access to TikTok began getting cut off for some US users about 90 minutes before the new law took effect late Saturday. The app was also unavailable via Apple's App Store in the hours leading up to midnight. Videos intermittently loaded on TikTok for a time, but the app also showed a blacked-out screen indicating network issues.

Saturday night's rolling cutoff for US TikTok users followed a report from The Information which said Oracle (ORCL), which manages TikTok's US servers, was set to begin shutting down servers that host TikTok's data as early as 9:00 p.m. ET.

The law that has resulted in TikTok's shutdown doesn't outright ban the app, but rather it prohibits users from accessing the platform through app stores, like those run by Apple (AAPL) and Google (GOOG, GOOGL), and cloud services unless parent company ByteDance sells itself to an owner that is not controlled by a country the US considers adversarial.

Congress has accused ByteDance of having close ties to the Chinese government and alleges that the Chinese Communist Party could force the company to provide it with information on US users or otherwise spread propaganda on the platform.

But the outcry from users and TikTok's backers forced President Joe Biden and Trump to respond. Even with Trump's assurances Apple and Google that his administration won't enforce the law, it's not guaranteed that his — or any other administration — would do so in the future. Each time the companies don't comply with the law they'd have to pay a fine of $5,000 each time a user accesses the social media app.

Trump will have to either convince Congress to overturn the ban or find some other way to work around it if he wants to keep the service up and running, and neither of those is simple.

'It's a good thing for Meta'

Should TikTok's ban eventually come to pass, one of the biggest winners could be one of TikTok’s long-term critics: Meta (META) CEO Mark Zuckerberg. In particular, Instagram, owned by Meta, could see a sizable uptick in advertiser dollars if TikTok bites the dust.

“In general, it’s a good thing for Meta,” William Blair research analyst Ralph Schackart told Yahoo Finance. “We estimate in a note potentially 60% to 70% of TikTok spend could move to Instagram and it monetizes at around 3x the rate of TikTok.”

Social media companies have been chasing TikTok’s formula in an attempt to copy the social media platform’s success for some time. Reddit (RDDT), for example, offers its own short-form video feed that could entice former TikTok users looking for a broader kind of social media site complete with various message boards and communities.

Snapchat (SNAP) could also grab users who would have otherwise spent time on TikTok — and the advertising dollars that follow. But as Morgan Stanley managing director Brian Nowak points out, Snap would have to ensure it can keep those TikTok refugees coming back over and over again — as TikTok does — if it hopes to hold onto that ad revenue.

Pinterest (PINS) also stands to get a boost if TikTok is forced to go dark. While the app doesn’t have much in common with TikTok as far as overall design, it could offer an opportunity for online retailers looking to drum up e-commerce sales, something TikTok has managed to do thanks to its army of influencers.Sign up for Yahoo Finance's Week in Tech newsletter.·yahoofinance

With additional reporting from Ben Werschkul.

Alexis Keenan is a legal reporter for Yahoo Finance. Follow Alexis on X @alexiskweed.

Email Daniel Howley at dhowley@yahoofinance.com. Follow him on Twitter at @DanielHowley.

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.75, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.25, Reasoning: The news indicates a generally optimistic outlook for the technology sector as President-elect Trump's administration is expected to reduce regulations and support sectors like tech, which includes Apple Inc. Additionally, positive sentiment from Wall Street and projections of strong earnings within the tech industry contribute to the likelihood of AAPL's stock price rising. The prediction of a 25% increase in tech stocks due to favorable conditions also supports this outlook. However, potential volatility stemming from Trump's unpredictable policies could introduce some uncertainty, which affects stock price movement. Therefore, the likelihood of AAPL's stock price rising is high, while the probability of it falling is relatively low given the current trends and expectations.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article focuses on the Davos World Economic Forum and various themes that will dominate discussions, including the potential impact of Trump's policies, interest rate outlook from big bank CEOs, tariff implications for retail companies, AI advancements and competition in the chip market, the crypto industry's perspective on recent volatility and regulatory changes, and overall market risks amidst a 'top-heavy' stock market. While Apple is not explicitly mentioned, there is oblique allusion to big tech which may be seen as positive factor. The increased uncertainty emanating from potential Trump policies, particularly regarding tariffs, represents a considerable downside risk. However, there is no specific mention of Apple's initiatives in Davos. The overall tone leans toward caution, influenced by economic and political uncertainties. Given that Davos involves discussion of broad economic and market trends rather than company specific news, the impact to any given name, even a magnificant 7 member like Apple is muted.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news highlights the significant institutional ownership (61%) of Apple stock. While high institutional ownership can be seen as positive, indicating confidence from large investors, it also introduces a risk factor.  Large institutional investors selling simultaneously could trigger a significant price drop.  The news also mentions recent insider sales, which is a negative signal. However, the article itself does not provide specifics on the volume or timing of these sales, which would significantly influence the impact. The overall tone of the article is neutral, presenting both the positive and negative aspects of high institutional ownership.  Given the lack of specific information on the insider sales and the inherent volatility of the market, predicting a definite rise or fall in price is difficult. I'm assigning slightly higher probability to a price drop due to the potential risk of coordinated institutional selling and the negative signal from insider sales, albeit this information is limited.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The provided news headline and content ('What Is the Nasdaq Composite Index?') does not contain any specific information about Apple Inc. (AAPL) or any material events that would directly impact its stock price. The Nasdaq Composite Index is a broad market index that includes many companies, and general information about it does not provide actionable insights for AAPL's stock movement. Therefore, the news is unlikely to have any significant effect on AAPL's stock price.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news about TikTok being restored and the involvement of President Trump and Apple Inc. (AAPL) in this matter has both positive and negative implications for AAPL's stock price. On the positive side, TikTok's restoration means that AAPL, as the operator of the App Store, will continue to offer TikTok for download, potentially maintaining revenue streams. Additionally, Trump's executive order aims to provide clarity and assurance to service providers like Apple. However, the uncertainty surrounding the legal basis of Trump's actions and the potential for future legal challenges create negative implications. Overall, the probabilities reflect a cautiously optimistic outlook with a slightly higher chance of the stock price rising than falling.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news article discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, and its potential impact on the stock market. While the article mentions various companies and their CEOs, it does not provide specific information about Apple Inc. (AAPL). However, it does mention the 'Magnificent 7' stocks, which includes Apple, and notes that these stocks are beginning to look top-heavy. The article also discusses the potential for market volatility due to Trump policies and the presence of crypto and AI-related discussions at the forum. Given the lack of specific information about Apple and the general uncertainty surrounding the market, I estimate that the probability of the stock price rising is slightly lower than the probability of it falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The financial news highlights significant institutional ownership and recent insider sales, which can impact Apple's stock price. Given that 61% of the stock is held by institutions, institutional movements could lead to volatility. Additionally, insider sales indicate caution among top executives. While institutional holdings typically stabilize stock price, recent actions suggest immediate price pressures could exist. These factors suggest a neutral to slightly bearish sentiment.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.68, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.32, Reasoning: The news highlights a generally positive outlook for the technology sector as the incoming Trump administration is expected to reduce regulations and potentially create a favorable environment for companies like Apple. This sentiment is bolstered by statements from major industry figures indicating increased confidence and optimism about economic growth. However, there is also an undercurrent of volatility associated with Trump's unpredictable policies, which could introduce some risk. The predictions from previous rounds suggest a trend of cautious optimism about Apple's stock price, with several models reflecting a tendency towards expecting a rise, though some indicate heightened risks due to institutional behaviors and market uncertainties. Considering all these factors, I assess a moderate probability for price increase amidst balanced uncertainty.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The article discusses the themes dominating the World Economic Forum in Davos. While Apple isn't explicitly mentioned extensively, it's part of the 'Magnificent 7' which are discussed as potentially 'top-heavy'. The article's broader themes like potential Trump tariffs, AI competition with companies like Microsoft and Google, and crypto volatility indirectly impact market sentiment. The emphasis on Trump's policies introduces uncertainty and market volatility, as does discussion of interest rates from the banking sector. The overall analysis suggests more reasons for slight bearishness on the stock market since its overall sentiments. In the previous rounds, the difference between the hightest and lowest predictions are significant, the lowest prediction of stock rising probability is 0.4, while the highest prediction is 0.75. The predictions in previous rounds demonstrates a trend of believing that stock may fall. Given that Apple is a component of the magnificent seven and that these stocks are deemed to be top heavy, the market risks generally outweigh Apple.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news focuses on the high institutional ownership (61%) of Apple stock.  While this can be seen as a positive indicator of confidence from large investors, it also introduces significant volatility risk.  A large, coordinated sell-off by these institutions could cause a substantial price drop.  The mention of recent insider sales further adds to negative sentiment. The lack of specifics regarding the volume and timing of these insider sales makes it difficult to precisely quantify their impact.  Considering the potential for institutional selling pressure and the negative signal from insider sales, combined with the inherent market volatility, the probability of a price drop appears slightly higher than a price rise.  The previous predictions show a range of sentiment from cautiously optimistic to more bearish, reflecting this inherent uncertainty.

(AAPL) or any material events that would directly impact its stock price. The Nasdaq Composite Index is a broad market index that includes many companies, and general information about it does not provide actionable insights for AAPL's stock movement. (AAPL) is not explicitly mentioned in the context of specific news that would directly affect its stock price, it is part of the 'Magnificent 7' stocks mentioned as beginning to look top-heavy. Given the lack of specific positive or negative information about Apple and considering the general market trends and uncertainties, I estimate that the probability of the stock price rising is slightly lower than the probability of it falling. This environment is likely to benefit major tech companies, including Apple, contributing to a stronger sentiment around the stock. Despite the optimism, there are underlying risks due to Trump's unpredictability and potential market volatility, which are reflected in the varying predictions from multiple models in previous rounds. Considering that the overall market sentiment, especially for tech stocks, leans slightly towards positive, I estimate a moderate probability of price increase for Apple.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The article discusses the Davos World Economic Forum and its potential implications for the market. While Apple isn't explicitly the focus, its membership in the 'Magnificent 7,' a group described as potentially 'top-heavy,' raises concerns. The discussions about Trump's policies, tariffs, AI competition (with mentions of Microsoft and Google vying with Nvidia), crypto volatility, and interest rate outlooks all contribute to the overall market sentiment. Given the uncertainty surrounding Trump's policies and the 'top-heavy' assessment of the Magnificent Seven, a slightly bearish outlook is warranted. Prior predictions show a trend towards believing the stock may fall, with increased bearishness in the last round. Insider sales and the potential for institutional selling pressure further solidify this bearish view. Therefore, the probability of a price fall is estimated to be moderately higher than the probability of a rise.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news focuses on the high institutional ownership (61%) of Apple stock. This is a double-edged sword. While it suggests confidence from large investors, it also increases the risk of significant price drops if these institutions decide to sell simultaneously.  The mention of recent insider sales adds to this negative sentiment, although the lack of specifics about the volume and timing of these sales limits the assessment of their impact.  The previous predictions show considerable divergence, ranging from strongly bullish to strongly bearish, highlighting the inherent uncertainty. Considering the potential for institutional selling pressure and the negative signal from insider sales, coupled with the general market volatility, I lean slightly towards a higher probability of a price fall. However, Apple's generally strong fundamentals and continued growth in certain sectors limit how far this probability can be weighted. The overall uncertainty suggests a relatively balanced prediction that reflects the mixed signals presented in the news.

Lower regulations and tax cuts could support tech companies like Apple, contributing to investor confidence. However, the unpredictability and potential market volatility stemming from Trump's administration introduces risks. Previous predictions reflect a mix of optimism and caution, with some uncertainty about institutional selling pressures. Overall, the sentiment is tilted towards a rise in Apple’s stock price, but the chance of a decline cannot be dismissed due to market volatility. Thus, I predict a slightly higher probability of a price rise than a fall.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos, highlighting key themes like Trump's potential policies, interest rate outlook, AI competition, crypto volatility, and tariff implications, particularly on the 'Magnificent 7' stocks, which includes Apple. While no specific direct news implicates Apple positively or negatively, being labeled as 'top-heavy' is concerning. Additionally, the discussion of potential market volatility stemming from Trump's policies introduces uncertainty. Taking into account past predictions, there is a trend toward increased bearishness on this news. Therefore, I anticipate a slightly higher chance of a price decrease.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news focuses on the high institutional ownership of Apple (61%), which is a double-edged sword. While it suggests confidence from large investors, it also significantly increases the risk of price drops if these institutions sell simultaneously.  The mention of recent insider sales adds to the negative sentiment. However, the lack of specifics regarding the volume or timing of these insider sales prevents a precise quantification of their impact.  Analyzing previous predictions reveals a range of sentiment, from cautiously optimistic to strongly bearish, reflecting the inherent uncertainty. The previous round predictions show a consistent trend towards a higher probability of a price fall, with the average probability of a fall being consistently above 0.5. Considering the potential institutional selling pressure and the negative signal from insider sales, coupled with the inherent market volatility and the trend from previous predictions, I lean towards a higher probability of a price fall. However, Apple's strong fundamentals and growth in some sectors prevent extreme weighting of this probability.  The overall uncertainty justifies a prediction reflecting the mixed signals presented in the news and the overall bearish trend from other models.

(AAPL) that would directly impact its stock price. The Nasdaq Composite Index is a broad market index, and general information about it does not offer actionable insights for AAPL's stock movement. Previous predictions from multiple models show a range of sentiments, from cautiously optimistic to bearish, but none are based on direct news about Apple. Given the lack of specific information and the neutral nature of the news, the probabilities are balanced. However, considering the broader market context and the trend in previous predictions, which slightly lean towards bearish sentiment due to factors like institutional ownership and insider sales, there is a slight inclination towards a potential fall in stock price.

(AAPL). The news does not directly mention any company-specific developments for Apple. However, the potential for a synchronized sell-off by these institutions poses a significant risk. Insider sales add additional downward pressure as they signal internal caution. Although there is confidence from institutional investors, the recent actions and market sentiments point toward a higher likelihood of a price decline.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The provided news discusses TikTok's temporary shutdown and restoration, involving President Trump and Apple Inc. (AAPL). The news does not directly impact Apple's stock price but implies potential regulatory relief and support from the Trump administration for tech companies. However, uncertainties surrounding Trump's policies and market volatility, including high institutional ownership and recent insider sales, contribute to a cautious outlook. The trend from previous predictions leans towards a slightly bearish sentiment, with probabilities of stock price falling generally higher than rising. Considering these factors, I estimate a balanced view with a slight inclination towards a potential fall in stock price due to overall market risks and uncertainties.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "TikTok says 'in the process of restoring service' after going dark in US, citing Trump 'clarity'",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.42,
  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.58
}
```
